column1: 2646079F-6B4D-4C94-9E44-74608ADD6FA6#appfire#F1A64065-066E-4DA4-8C9C-3F37D1106E71#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 13:09:48.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 13:09:48.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#3DE61AD0-C9B2-488D-9522-AA535DC2877B#appfire#F1A64065-066E-4DA4-8C9C-3F37D1106E71#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 13:09:48.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 13:09:48.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#74589D4A-B8C0-431B-83FE-F25E80653F44#appfire#F1A64065-066E-4DA4-8C9C-3F37D1106E71#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 13:09:48.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-31 13:09:48.0#appfire#1
